"Some of the material in this volume originally appeared in Vietnam journal #1-4, from Apple Comics."

50.heading: Fields, Rubi.
50.title: "The New Frontier"
50.author: by John Sabljic ; illustrated by Michael Cherkas
50.appears_in: p. 97-112 in Heavy Metal, v. 14, no. 6 (Jan. 1991).
notes: Summary: Candidate Ivor Wynne wins the primary with the help of Sandi Shores, blonde bombshell. Her agenda conflicts with that of the party and the mob, but includes promising an investigation into the death of Rubi Fields. Rubi Fields is a Marilyn Monroe figure, who sang "Happy Birthday" to President K two decades before.

52.heading: Fields, Suzanne.
52.title: Flesh Gordon [videorecording]
52.author: presented by Hen's Tooth Video and by Mammoth Films.
notes: First issued 1974 as a motion picture.
Cast: Jason Williams, Suzanne Fields, Joseph Hudgins, William Hunt, John Hoyt as Professor Gordon.

Summary: "In this popular outrageous spoof of sci-fi films, Earth is thrown onto carnal chaos by a mysterious sex ray emanating from outer space. Flesh Gordon, Dale Ardor and their new found friend Dr. Flexi Jerkoff, must travel to the planet Porno to save Earth from certain devastation by the mad Emperor Wang. Includes 10 minutes of previously unseen footage and original trailer.
"This program contains mature subject matter. It is intended for viewing by adult audiences, 18 years and older."
